lessons.title: Day 1: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
lessons.introduction: Artificial Intelligence (AI) involves creating systems that mimic human intelligence. This lesson covers the basics, history, and applications of AI.
lessons.coreConcept: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, enabling tasks like learning, reasoning, and self-correction. It spans narrow AI, which excels in specific tasks like image recognition, to aspirational general AI, capable of performing any intellectual task a human can. For example, AI powers virtual assistants like Siri, which interpret voice commands and respond intelligently.

table.Description: Designed for specific tasks with high efficiency

lessons.diagram:
AI Hierarchy:
  Super AI
  ↑
  General AI
  ↑
  Narrow AI
    └─ Task-specific (e.g., Siri -> Voice recognition -> Response generation)

mcq.question: What distinguishes Narrow AI from General AI?
options: Narrow AI is task-specific, General AI is versatile
General AI is used in smartphones
mcq.explanation: Narrow AI performs specific tasks, while General AI aims to handle any intellectual task.

references.title: Coursera: AI For Everyone
references.description: An online course by Andrew Ng covering AI fundamentals.

lessons.title: Day 35: AI for Time-Series Analysis
lessons.introduction: AI analyzes time-series data for forecasting.
lessons.coreConcept: Time-series analysis predicts future values based on historical sequential data, using models like LSTMs for complex patterns. It’s critical for applications like stock price prediction. For example, LSTMs forecast weather by modeling temperature trends over time.
lessons.diagram:
Time-Series Forecasting:
  Historical Data (t1, t2, ...) -> Model (e.g., LSTM)
  ↓
  Prediction (t_n+1)

mcq.question: What is a common AI model for time-series forecasting?
mcq.explanation: LSTMs are effective for complex time-series patterns.

lessons.title: Day 36: AI and Robotics
lessons.introduction: AI enables robots to perform tasks autonomously.
lessons.coreConcept: AI in robotics combines perception, planning, and control to enable autonomous tasks like navigation and manipulation. Techniques like SLAM allow robots to map environments. For example, warehouse robots use AI to navigate and pick items efficiently.
lessons.diagram:
Robotics Pipeline:
  Sensors -> Perception (SLAM)
  ↓
  Planning (Path) -> Control (Move Robot)

mcq.question: What does SLAM do in robotics?
mcq.explanation: SLAM enables robots to map and navigate environments.

lessons.title: Day 37: AI for Speech Recognition
lessons.introduction: Speech recognition converts audio to text.
lessons.coreConcept: Speech recognition transcribes spoken language into text using AI techniques like feature extraction and sequence modeling. It powers voice assistants like Alexa. For example, deep learning models process audio waveforms to transcribe meetings accurately.
lessons.diagram:
Speech Recognition:
  Audio Input -> Feature Extraction (MFCC)
  ↓
  Model (RNN/CTC) -> Text Output

mcq.question: What do MFCCs do in speech recognition?
mcq.explanation: MFCCs extract audio features for speech recognition.

lessons.title: Day 38: AI for Recommender Systems
lessons.introduction: Recommender systems personalize content for users.
lessons.coreConcept: Recommender systems suggest items based on user preferences, using collaborative or content-based filtering. They power platforms like Netflix for personalized recommendations. For example, collaborative filtering recommends movies based on user ratings.
lessons.diagram:
Recommender System:
  User Data (Ratings/Features) -> Model
  ↓
  Output: Personalized Recommendations

mcq.question: What does collaborative filtering use?
mcq.explanation: Collaborative filtering uses user-item interactions for recommendations.

lessons.title: Day 39: Quantum AI
lessons.introduction: Quantum AI leverages quantum computing for AI tasks.
lessons.coreConcept: Quantum AI uses quantum computers to enhance AI algorithms, potentially offering exponential speedups for tasks like optimization. It leverages quantum properties like superposition. For example, quantum AI could optimize complex neural network training in the future.
lessons.diagram:
Quantum AI:
  Classical Data -> Quantum Circuit (Qubits + Gates)
  ↓
  Output: Optimized Solution (e.g., ML Model)

mcq.question: What is a potential benefit of quantum AI?
mcq.explanation: Quantum AI offers potential speedup for complex computations.

references.title: Quantum Machine Learning
references.description: A paper by Google Quantum AI.

lessons.title: Day 40: Future of AI
lessons.introduction: The future of AI includes advancements and challenges.
lessons.coreConcept: The future of AI involves advancements in capability, integration with IoT, and ethical considerations to ensure responsible development. Emerging trends include AI-driven automation and fairness in algorithms. For example, AI in smart cities optimizes traffic using IoT data.
lessons.diagram:
Future AI:
  Trends -> [IoT Integration, Ethical AI, Automation]
  ↓
  Applications (Smart Cities, Fair Systems, Robotics)

mcq.question: What is a future trend in AI?
mcq.explanation: AI integration with IoT is a key future trend.
